reviewText: I liked the way the movie builds up to a climax! I only wish i spoke German. But very well done!
This is the same movie, albeit not as good technical quality, as Empire of Passion.  Do nbot make the same mistake I did, thinking this was The Realm of the Senses.
I love Japanese horror films.  This one is creepy and has strong sexual content. I liked the movie but the end wasn't that great.

At last, Oshima's movies were produced on DVD with reliable info on English subtitles: all the previous stuff just combined Japanese, French and Chinese wording, misleadingly mentioning a range of language options available. Although contexts of these movies are understandable even without text ( Ai no corrida- ("In the Realm of the Senses" is a nice soft-porno work exploring mutilation and incest much prior to other Japanese movies of the end of the last twentieth century), The Empire of Passion (L' Empire de la passion / Ai no borei (Original Japenese with French Version Included - No English Options)) is a simple story of lust and love in the Japanese countryside of the ninetieth century fall, where emotions and traditional local mysticism emphasised on a backstage of sexual explorations. Beautiful cast acting convincingly adds to positive comprehension of this ordinary melodrama.

Completely unwatchable drivel. In the Realm of Senses pushed the envelope with its sexual themes and graphic depictions of sexual acts. In the Realm of Passion seems to want to capitalize on that, but it fails miserably. No real plot (some sort of insanity and a ghost story of some kind), sex, and nothing interesting or engaging at all here. Do not bother with this.
This film contains so much violence, paranoia, and  madness.  The story is kinda slow, but the ending  is quite heart-shaking and depressing.  The cinematography is almost like film noir.
